p: HIV-1 remains at a high prevalence among men who have sex with men (MSMs) in developed countries. In the United States, in 2010, MSMs represented 63% of the estimated total number of new HIV infections, and the prevalence of HIV in this subpopulation was approximately 18% [ 11]. Despite an increase in the proportion of individuals treated with highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART), the incidence rate of HIV in MSMs in the United States has increased by an estimated 12% between 2008 and 2010.
